did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Methodist Episcopal Church of Painted Post records, 1868-1877.

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Methodist Episcopal Church of Painted Post (Painted Post, N.Y.)

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: One volume of Sunday School meeting minutes (1868-1877) including number of teachers, officers and scholars present.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: In 1832 Painted Post was set off as a separate circuit containing (as of 1837) Little Flatts, Painted Post, Addison Village, West Addison, Erwin Center, Campbell and Tioga. It divided in 1833, 1839, and again in 1843 when Erwin, Painted Post and Campbell formed a circuit named after the latter two towns. In 1850 a church was erected on Chemung and Steuben Streets in Painted Post. Nothing is known about the formation of activities of the Sunday School.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: One volume of Sunday School meeting minutes (1868-1877) including number of teachers, officers and scholars present.
